This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, community service options, and leadership initiatives, along with
other student opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age
requirements, and other pre-requisites for participation.
Some program deadlines are fast approaching – please do not miss them!
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
There are a number of other excellent opportunities in this issue with fast-approaching
deadlines - including several highlighted below. Of special interest is our Alumni
Association’s Student Mentoring Program – this is a wonderful opportunity to meet
and get support from successful, supportive Stuy alums about careers, college,
interview/resume skills, and much more; the application deadline is 10/28.
ACADEMICS: Two more colleges have opened registration for the CUNY College
Now program, which offers free courses at campuses around the city for juniors,
seniors, and, in some cases, sophomores – Hunter & Baruch Colleges are now
online, with others to follow in the coming weeks. And the Stem Research Academy
at City Tech in Brooklyn offers excellent free STEM-focused programs for the spring
& summer terms – current sophomores & juniors may apply. There is also a 10/28
free biology-oriented Columbia University Human Transcriptome program open to
all students, with another to follow in November.
BUSINESS: The Harvard BOLD Conference for female students is scheduled for
November 11 and 12; there are virtual and in-person options. And current seniors
from under-represented backgrounds (including Asian-American students) can apply
for the Emma Bowen Media/Business Internship, which provides generous paid
summer internships.
MUSEUMS/ART: The Discover Architecture program offers a free week with
professionals in this field during the February break – 10th and 11th graders may apply.
There are also low-cost Teen Architecture workshops on Urban Planning &
Model-Making coming up on 11/4 and beyond.
PARKS: The Brooklyn Botanic Garden “Garden Apprentice Program (GAP) has
an online information session set for Octeober 28th – current 9th, 10th, and 11th grade
students are eligible.
STEM: Last chance to apply for the Ace Mentor Program, which provides students
of all grades with a ‘real-world’ in-person internship opportunity with a team of
architects & engineers from the Port Authority, located ten minutes from Stuy. The
application deadline is October 31st!

students may apply). This course gives students an opportunity to explore cell biology,
